docs.title: Converting from Windows to New OS
docs.text:
1. Create a bootable USB with desired operating system
  2. When booting up, press F12
  3. Allow "boot from USB" in BIOS
  4. Follow installer instructions

docs.title: Atsumeru
docs.text: Atsumeru runs in docker and is used as a self-hosted book server. With it, I can orgainize, manage, and read novels rather easily. I'm using the container from atsumerudev/atsumeru. The run command on that page was necessary to have it run on portainer. Sadly, Atsumeru has not been updatd since last year, so I may have to search for a different hosting service.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
docker run -d \
    --name=atsumeru \
    -p 31337:31337 \
    -v /path/to/your/library:/home/remus/media \
    -v /path/to/your/config:/container/atsumeru \
    -v /path/to/your/db:/container/atsumeru \
    -v /path/to/your/cache:/container/atsumeru \
    -v /path/to/your/logs:/container/atsumeru \
    --restart unless-stopped \
    atsumerudev/atsumeru:latest

docs.title: Factorio Server
docs.text: Factorio is a management and automation game I enjoy on my free time. The server allows me to host a multiplayer session with other players. The server is run on Debian Virtual Machine.

docs.title: Plex
docs.text: Plex is the app that allows me to view my media. It is an extremely powerful media center with auto searching of folders, auto grabbing of posters, transcoding built in, ability to sign in with a Google account and so much more. Plex is available to me anywhere in the world on both the web and the mobile app.

docs.title: Portainer
docs.text: Portainer is a web-GUI that is helpful for managing/deploying/editing docker containers. As I get more understanding with docker compose, I may transition from portainer to that.

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
Setup:

First created a LXC container using Ubuntu as the template Installed Docker using apt repository https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/ Install Portainer for a GUI See Configuration below Install net tools apt install net-tools

To enter Portainer, enter Calzone IP with Portainer’s port (9443) in search bar

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The docker run command 

docker run -d \
    -p 8000:8000 \
    -p 9443:9443 \
    --name portainer \
    --restart=always \
    -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
    -v portainer_data:/data \
    portainer/portainer-ce:latest
